Adenosine monophosphate (ANP): A nucleotide found amoung the hydrolysis products of all nucleic acids; also called adenylic acid.
Cardiovascular: Relating to the heart and the blood vessels or the circulation.
Ecosystem: The interacting system of a biological community and its environment.

sequence.author: Enzyme Commission (EC):
sequence.title: The International Commission on Enzymes, established in 1956, developed a scheme of classification and nomenclature under which each enzyme is assigned an EC number which identifies it by function.
Forced vital capacity (FVC): The greatest volume of air that can be exhaled from the lungs under forced conditions after a maximum inspiration.
H-Thymidine: Jhymine deoxyribonucleoside: One of the four major nucleosides in DNA. H-thymidine has been uniformly labeled with tritium, a radioactive form of hydrogen.
Molecular weight: The weight of one molecule of a substance obtained by adding the gram-atomic weights of each of the individual atoms in the substance.
Nares: The nostrils.
Nasopharyngeal: Relating to the nasal cavity and the pharynx (throat).
National Air Surveillance Network (NASN): Network of monitoring stations for sampling air to determine extent of air pollution; established jointly by federal and state governments.
sequence.container-title: Near ultraviolet: Radiation of the wavelengths 2000-4000 Angstroms.
